data.value: Several estimation methods are available using the
parameter. By default, a method is selected based the size of the sample.
This function will converge to the true differential entropy in the limit
for a given sample size depends on the (unknown) distribution. Typically, the smoother the density of the distribution, the larger the optimal value of
The following options are available for the
uses the estimator presented in . This is   one of the first and most influential estimators of differential entropy.
uses the bias-corrected estimator presented in , which   is not only consistent but, under some conditions, asymptotically normal.
uses an estimator presented in , which was shown   in simulation to have smaller bias and mean squared error than   the Vasicek estimator.

uses the estimator presented in  based on local linear   regression. In a simulation study, it had consistently smaller mean   square error than the Vasiceck estimator, but it is more expensive to   compute.
selects the method automatically (default). Currently,   this selects
for larger   samples, but this behavior is subject to change in future versions.
All estimators are implemented as described in .
Window length for computing Vasicek estimate. Must be an integer between 1 and half of the sample size. If
(the default), it uses the heuristic value
is the sample size. This heuristic was originally proposed in  and has become common in the literature.
The logarithmic base to use, defaults to
The axis along which the differential entropy is calculated. Default is 0.
The method used to estimate the differential entropy from the sample. Default is
Given a sample of a distribution, estimate the differential entropy.
Entropy of a standard normal distribution:
For several sample sizes between 5 and 1000, compare the accuracy of the
methods. Specifically, compare the root mean squared error (over 1000 trials) between the estimate and the true differential entropy of the distribution.

link.data: # number of repetitions for each sample size

signature.value: differential_entropy(values: 'np.typing.ArrayLike', *, window_length: 'Optional[int]' = None, base: 'Optional[float]' = None, axis: 'int' = 0, method: 'str' = 'auto') -> 'Union[np.number, np.ndarray]'
